poem:
**Factory Raid**

In Georgia's heat,  
a factory piles high  
with dreams of distant lands—  
hands to batteries,  
cogs of hope  
stilled by cold cuffs.  
Across the sea,  
voices rise,  
a nation gathers strength  
in the echo,  
promising return,  
their roots unbound.  
Stitch together,  
the lost threads,  
woven anew in light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Seoul promises to help hundreds of Korean workers arrested in US in Ice raid South Korea’s president, Lee Jae Myung, has ordered “all-out efforts” to respond to the arrest of hundreds of its citizens by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice) during a raid at a factory being built in Georgia to manufacture car batteries. Cho Hyun, the foreign minister, said the government had set up a taskforce following the arrest of 300 South Korean". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
